intro: Aragallus grandiflorus, commonly known as the large-flowered aragallus, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes in South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine, silky hair, giving them a soft texture. Aragallus grandiflorus is often grown in gardens for its ornamental value and is adapted to cool, moist climates.
